name: Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our way to Oz and Fiji. Bora Bora is amazing but we will never stay at this hotel again. I felt like we were gouged for every dollar, and I am a Gold Hilton Honors member. Upon arrival at the airport in Bora Bora, there is a lovely private Hilton white yacht to pick you up with flowers. Staff takes your bags and ushers you aboard. No one told us - even when I specifically asked - how much this yacht service was ($75 USD per person each way). Once arriving on the island (it is located on its own "moto" offshore from the main island of Bora Bora) at noon, we were told we could not check into our room until check in time, even though the room was ready to be occupied and I had confirmed early check in. This was annoying since we flew over 12 hours to get there and were in need of a shower. The food was horribly expensive and not that good. The boat shuttle to the main island was an additional cost so unless you wanted to be stuck you had to pay. Overall the staff was rude.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location, Wrong Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we decided to use the free public ferry from the airport to the main island and then take the free Hotel ferry from the main island to the hotel. It worked out nicely and the hotel took our bags directly from the airport to the hotel with no extra charge. (note - the hotel ferry from the airport to the hotel directly is about $85 each way.) The check is was alright... but like a lot of others have already noted, they required my diamond card since they had no clue what status I was. We also had to remind them several times during the check in to verify 1) free breakfast and 2) water delivery to the room.
reviews.title: Great Location and Activities...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first day we got there the activities person wasn't very nice.. .however later in our trip there was a different person who was really really nice and excellent to work with.
reviews.title: view of nature in pristine condition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The snorkeling was okay there.. but go early in the morning as the wind picks up by mid-day.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definately go for the reef shark / ray feeding .. was absolutely awesome and felt safe the whole time. The rays were really friendly and fantastic to swim with. The sharks were not agressive towards us at all.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought the property was outstanding, but the staff excelled and made our stay perfect!
reviews.title: Retuurn visit even better!
Amazing Stay / Will come back again
reviews.text: I was hear for 4 days on my honeymoon and what a beautiful resort! We were greated by a live band and escorted to check in on the resort. Check in was simple and easy. We were a little nervous as we booked everything online. But before we knew it we were taken to our villa via golf cart, as it was a bit farther away from the reception center. Once we got to the villa, there was champagne and snorkel gear awaiting us. We started off the honeymoon right away and enjoyed this resort. Resort is very quite, seemed to be more couples and more secluded. Only con, We did go to the main island for dinner one night, the ferry only had one late evening pick up. We were hoping there would be something later as we wanted to stay out and enjoy the evening. But, overall beautiful resort. We did stay at another resort in Bora Bora on the other side of the island which I will provide a review for later.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort was a fabulous experience! We absolutely loved it! It is very peaceful and very accomodating. The staff is so friendly and nice, we appreciated everybody's kindness and effort to make our stay perfect! As for beauty, this is tops, absolutely gorgeous!!! I'm already looking forward to returning some day :)
reviews.title: Absolutely loved our experience!
Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our anniversary in French Polynesia and we visited Bora Bora after Moorea. I honestly cannot decide which island I enjoyed more. They were both unique and beautiful and I loved them both! However, Bora Bora was definitely the best choice to end our trip. We stayed at the Hilton Bora Bora Nui in a deluxe overwater bungalow and I was speechless. The water was deep and mesmerizing, and we enjoyed being able to get in the lagoon whenever we wanted. Our bungalow was very well appointed, with nice furniture, comfortable bed and huge bathroom. We spent hours watching the fish swim below our bungalow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is located on a private island so getting to and from the main island wasn’t as easy exploring Moorea, but we enjoyed the Hilton so much we didn’t want to leave. The snorkeling was excellent (although we thought it was actually a little bit better in Moorea) but the water was so beautiful and inviting that we spent much more time snorkeling and swimming in the lagoon on Bora Bora than in Moorea. We also enjoyed the hotel’s hobie cat and a hotel staff person took us out to the reef on it for free!
reviews.title: Beautiful & romantic escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Bora Bora in May 2010 and stayed at the Hilton Bora Bora Nui Spa and resort in an Overwater Bungalow. I have to say, if you go there and don't stay in one of those, you are truely missing out. The bungalow was amazing! It was spacious and beautiful and had the best bathroom shower ever. It was a stunning room, with a stunning view and I can't explain how happy we were when we walked in. The hotel staff was so friendly and so nice. The amenities were great, the beach was super clear sparkly. We took advantage of the spa and had a really good massage and it was so worth the money we spent. The manager of the hotel was the nicest. He made sure he knew my boyfriends name and greeted us everytime he saw us by name and so did everyone else in reception. The grounds were beautiful i can't say enough about what an amazing time we had. I would go back in a heartbeat over and over again!
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS! MOST ROMANTIC PLACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our honeymoon stay Iphone & charger were stolen our in room n.322 firmly locked on july 31 2010, Immediatly reported to managers. Useless. Hotel very badly managed, mostly in security and guest relations. More thefts reported by other guests and local Police (Gendarmerie).
reviews.title: Viaggio di nozze con furto e rumori vari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Structure & position A class. Restaurants just average too. Not romantic. Very cold atmosphere. Rooms top level but with very noisy air conditioning.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not suggested.
reviews.title: Breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in hotels internationally more than 100 nights per year and I have to say that The Hilton Bora Bora Nui is in a league of it's own. The service is exceptional, the resort and location could not be better and the staff are so discreet, professional yet friendly and always helpful, it was a breath of fresh air in today's declining standards. I can't wait to go back. Congratulations Hilton Boar Bora
reviews.title: As Close to Paradise as I'll Ever Get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know if we will be able to top our trip to the Hilton on Bora Bora. Absolutely fantastic accomodations, an incredible view, and awesome staff. Food on Bora Bora (along with everything else ) is expensive. Be prepared to pay up to US$300/day for meals. Soft drinks are about $8.00, hamburgers w/fries about $35. I think this is likely the same at all the Bora Bora resorts due to its isolated location. Even with the high prices, the Hilton on Bora Bora was well worth it!
reviews.title: Trip of a Lifetime - Hilton Bora Bora was Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days in an overwater bungalow after spending 5 days in Moorea. I cant imagine anywhere else more beautiful. The snorkling just off our deck was amazing, we saw an octopus, rays and many tropical fish that would come right up to you if you have bread that we took from the restaurant. We also went on a snorkle/swim with sharks and ray tour that was the highlight of our trip! They took us to the most beautiful place to snorkle!
reviews.title: Friendly staff and locals!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only compaint was ants in our bathroom! It was very expensive also but we were well aware of that before we left. The total cost from Edmonton AB Canada, 5 days in Moorea and 5 in BoraBora at the Hilton was $12000.00 Canadian. We did a quad trip and scooter rental in Moorea, bought black pearl earings and tattoos! Went golfing too.
reviews.title: The hotel is amazing and the staff are exceptional!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: March was a good time to go, very quiet, half full occupancy
reviews.title: Amazing snorkeling, private island, Hilton is awesome!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is amazing and the staff are exceptional!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in May as part of our 10 year Anniversary. We stayed in Moorea for 6 nights before going to Bora Bora. This hotel and it’s grounds are breathtaking! We are Hilton Honors members and used points to book our room, and then paid to upgrade to an overwater bungalow – well worth it! This bungalow (#123) was beautiful with a traditional Polynesian feel. The hotel is on a motu, so Hilton has a boat shuttle that runs on the hour to get to to/from town. This was such a nice feature!
reviews.title: Bora Bora Hilton Trip Report

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. We needed a converter to charge a laptop and nook and they let us borrow on from the front desk for the week! (There were no US plugs in our bungalow like we had in Moorea – not a big deal, just nice to know before you go!). They were also very helpful in booking excursions.
reviews.title: More Beautiful Than You Can Imagine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very nice that the hotel offers free activities. We enjoyed the paddle boats, kayaks, and they even have a Hobie cat that runs in the afternoons! One of the guys who runs the activities desk at the pool will take people out for a 30-45 minute ride to get a different perspective of the water. We also LOVED the cooking class. They offer it once a week, and they taught us how to make poisson cru – YUM!
reviews.title: once in a lifetime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The snorkeling is nice here too, although it’s much deeper than Moorea, so there isn’t as much visibility. The fish however are much bigger!
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have ever been ... great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the spa are a must, and the hike to get to the spa is beautiful – again the grounds here are well manicured and full of flowers.
reviews.title: Amazing for a quiet vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our second trip back to Bora Bora, but first time at this hotel.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First part of our stay was in a bungalow up in the hill. The room seemed a bit dated and dark. It had a leaky roof and electrical issues (safe would not work at times). When the wind kicks up at night, sand would blow in through cracks in the sliding doors. We did enjoy the commanding view of the entire property from our balcony and we did not mind the long hike up to our room. Great exercise!
reviews.title: Overwater bungalows are awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then, we moved to an OWB for the second part of our stay. The room was a bit smaller, but much brighter. The room still seemed a bit dated.
reviews.title: Perfect for our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did try to visit the spa/gym one day, but it was very disappointing. There were very little supplies (shampoo, lotion, shower caps and etc.) and no towels.
reviews.title: Not the right place to stay in Bora Bora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was nice that the Hotel supplied 3 computers for guests to use internet, but the connection was very slow, had malfunctioning keyboards and were always taken.
reviews.title: A paradise when you want to celebrate an anniversary or are looking for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from Bora Bora and Moorea and loved it. Bora Bora is beautiful. The Hilton was wonderful, the staff were friendly, rooms were stunning (OWB), complimentary snorkel equipment and Kayaks which was a nice touch. We travelled as a family and really enjoyed it. We did the Lagoon safari which was amazing (feeding sharks and stingrays with Leo our tour operator - highly recommend) the beach bbq provided was better than many restaurants.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Talking of which we all loved the Buffet breakfast, but got a little bored of the food in the two restaurants for our evening meals but if you choose to you can get the boat over to the Main Island or one of the other hotels. We tried the Meridien which was very nice. The gym was well equipped here too.
reviews.title: Vacation of a Life Time! Truly Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it is a must to get an OWB here.
reviews.title: We did not want to leave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and very sincere. The hotel is located in Paradise off the coast of Bora Bora. There simply is no place more beautiful on earth. We hope to return as soon as we can. The hotel was fantastically designed. The layout of the overwater bungalows was perfect for our romantic getaway. We got engaged on our back deck over the beautiful waters of the South Pacific and then decided to get married while we were there.
reviews.title: Trip of a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You must take a boat to get to the resort. It was remote and quiet. The staff was super helpful and considerate. It felt private even though there were others staying there. We watched the sunset daily. The food however was not good. They have two restaurants at the resort, my recommendation is to have dinner at Iriatai as much as possible. Note that the International Buffet on Tuesday nights are $100 per person and not worth it. The best option is to catch the taxi to the main island of Bora Bora and dine at Le Matira Beach. Our meal was out-of-this-world.
reviews.title: Great resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing. We took a water taxi from the port to the hotel and arrived at the 'lagoon' which was perfect for snorkelling. They even had left over bread ready for you to feed the fish while you were down there. We stayed for lunch which was excellent and not inexpensive. Extremely good value for money. Before we left, the hotel gave us a tour of the rooms, water bungalows and spa. I hope to visit again one day, for a longer stay. It was idyllic.
reviews.title: Visited for Lunch during Tahitian Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: (Actual date of visit was probably October 2005)
reviews.title: Fun and Romance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the best birthday celebration. I chose Bora Bora because I wanted an over the water bungalow but what I didn't know was all the extras I got from staying at the Hilton Bora Bora. The location is the best for views, romance, snorkeling and overall romance. My husband and i love to travel and i must say, we were so impressed with the service we received. I felt like a queen:) and of course, the food was out of this world. I would go back in a heart beat. Add to your bucket list, we just loved it,
reviews.title: Wed loved it and I can recommend for everyone :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a perfect location, amazing view and facilities.. the hotel crew is amazing and very helpful, so I can just recommend to go there, you will never forget this experience...
reviews.title: Friendly staff and beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing :)
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, solid choice

aka: Hilton Bora Bora Nui Hotel Bora Bora
description: Bora Bora… it’s possibly the most glamorously famous island in the world. Bora Bora’s legends, mysteries and romance lend an almost mystical dimension to its very name. The island rises up from the middle of the crystalline, multi-colored waters of its celebrated lagoon which is protected in turn from the ocean by a string of tiny coral islets.Suspended between turquoise waters and limitless skies, the Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort & Spa nestles in a sacred cove of white sand and majestic lava rock. Here you will find a sensitive blend of authenticity and luxury - the very best of Polynesian tradition combined with sumptuous comfort.
